wikipedia_page.main: Gareth Andrew Duke (born 18 June 1986) is a former Paralympic swimmer from Great Britain competing in S6 classification events. Duke attended two Summer Paralympic Games winning gold in the 2004 Summer Paralympics in Athens. Duke has represented Britain at two IPC Swimming World Championships and has also held world records in several events. He is the cousin of para-athlete Kyron Duke.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 2008 Summer Paralympics

response: Duke was born in Newport, south Wales in 1992, but now lives in Pontnewydd near Cwmbran. He was born with achondroplasia a form of dwarfism. His older cousin Gareth Duke also has the same condition and represented Great Britain as a swimmer in the 2004 and 2008 Olympic Games, winning gold, silver and bronze medals.

link_mentions.page: Swimming at the 2004 Summer Paralympics – Men's 100 metre breaststroke SB6
response: The Men's 100 metre breaststroke SB6 swimming event at the 2004 Summer Paralympics was competed on 24 September. It was won by Gareth Duke, representing .
